NAME: Four-leaf Clover
DESCRIPTION: Luck bonus (+2) on skill, attack or saving throw 3/day
NOTES: Mainly expect to use this on saving throws; you probably make about 3 really important ones per day, and they tend to be quite obvious.

NAME: Gloves of Reconnaissance
DESCRIPTION: Once/day, place your hands against a wall to see through it
NOTES: Cheap and useful for e.g. looking inside boxes to see what's inside or if they're trapped.

NAME: Runeward Tattoo
DESCRIPTION: Choose a spell school; +1 insight on saves against it, detect magic at-will for it, and automatically sense when someone casts a spell from it within 60ft
NOTES: In some campaigns (mainly undead-themed ones with necromancy spells) this is another way to efficiently boost saves. Buying 7 tattoos is the same price as upgrading Cloak of Resistance from +4 to +5, so eventually worth doing.

NAME: Boots of Striding and Springing
DESCRIPTION: Increased move speed (10ft) and bonus to jumping
NOTES: Useful to offset slow speed from armour or size - going from 30ft to 20ft hurts or 20ft to 15ft really hurts

NAME: Bane Baldric
DESCRIPTION: Swift action bane on a light or one-handed melee weapon, 5 rounds/day
NOTES: Expensive, not much duration, but impressive damage boost. Recommend this most highly on brawlers, they don't have an innate swift action use and it combines nicely with flurry.

NAME: Jaunt Boots
DESCRIPTION: 3/day move up to 15ft without provoking AoOs
NOTES: Strong on casters, to move away and cast. Extra strong on gishy casters with reach weapons - if people want to approach after you move away they eat an AoO. Good alternative to acrobatics.

NAME: Sipping Jacket
DESCRIPTION: Put a potion in jacket, can drink potion as swift action and split up potion's duration round-by-round.
NOTES: Even though it costs 5000 gold, this item only really comes online much later, once decent-CL potions of first-level spells become cheap. Still, once it does it's nuts. Standout potions: enlarge person, vanish.

NAME: Treasure Hunter's Goggles
DESCRIPTION: Detect secret doors constantly, identify 3/day, locate coins within 520ft 1/day.
NOTES: The standout here is constant detect secret doors - that ability's much stronger when you don't need to know to turn it on. The other things are nice to have, but not amazing

NAME: Boots of the Cat
DESCRIPTION: After a fall, take minimum damage and don't become prone

NAME: Horseshoes of a Zephyr
DESCRIPTION: Horse hovers just above ground
NOTES: Not really flight, but still lets your horse auto-avoid floor nastiness. Unclear how useful walking on water will be - potentially amusing in a naval campaign.

NAME: Sandals of Quick Reaction
DESCRIPTION: Take standard and move during surprise round, not just standard
NOTES: You need good perception for these to be worth it, to maximise the chance you're in a surprise round. Most obviously good on archers, lets them full attack

NAME: Horseshoes of Speed
DESCRIPTION: +30ft movespeed to horse

NAME: Hand of Glory
DESCRIPTION: Can use an extra ring; see invisibility and daylight 1/day each
NOTES: Kind of slotless, in that it gives you an extra ring slot. Much cheaper to just buy see invis potions for the effect, but daylight is nice for countering darkness and oils of it are expensive.

NAME: Longarm Bracers
DESCRIPTION: 3/day gain 5ft reach as a swift action; lasts until your next turn, so increases threatened area. Imposes penalty on attacks other than unarmed strike
NOTES: Obviously good on unarmed strikers, but also worth considering on anyone who has both reach and high to-hit - 15ft reach is an impressive lockdown area.

NAME: Handy Haversack
DESCRIPTION: Bag of holding but small but you can find shit easier
NOTES: Lets you ignore carrying capacity while still easily accesing your stuff.

NAME: Banner of Restful Nights
DESCRIPTION: Banner protects against cold and heat while you rest and warns you if anything approaches
NOTES: Party item. Alarm's cheap and on a bunch of lists, but if you don't have access to it then this is quite nice. Also helps against the environment - endure elements probably won't last all day

NAME: Decanter of Endless Water
DESCRIPTION: Infinite water source. Can produce anything from a stream to a geyser

NAME: Folding Boat
DESCRIPTION: Portable ship that can carry 15 people
NOTES: Used as a boat: opens up rivers as an easy means of travel and transport in exploration campaigns. Used as not a boat: deployable Big Object for cover, a wall, etc.

NAME: Lyre of Building
DESCRIPTION: Lets you rapidly construct something 1/week - the higher your perform check, the more you can build
NOTES: This is absurd. Reshape the world as you see fit. With +17 to perform, you don't need to stop. Get the whole party past any traversal obstacle by building a bridge or a tunnel. Construct a fort around anything you want to defend. Reshape the landscape however you wish.

NAME: Gloves of Shaping
DESCRIPTION: Lets you reshape materials softer than metal like they were clay
NOTES: WIth these, you have constant access to materials that are easily sculptable and yet still quite strong. Also great at getting you past any physical obstacle - doors, walls, boxes.

NAME: Adamantine Weapon
DESCRIPTION: Overcomes DR (usually of constructs), lets you easily cut through anything softer than itself
NOTES: Cheapest way to reliably get through doors. Unlike similar options, tunneling with these still probably takes time

NAME: Mirror of Guarding Reflections
DESCRIPTION: 3/day immediate action mirror image, gives disadvantage when the image is broken; must be held to be used
NOTES: Everyone who has a hand free should be holding one of these as soon as they can afford it. Basically better than AC.

NAME: Phantasmal Gem
DESCRIPTION: 10 rounds/day of concentration illusion lasting beyond concentration ending; can be recharged by gnomes
NOTES: Mainly for using illusions in combat, because the concentration on them hurts there the most and out-of-combat 10 rounds isn't long

NAME: Whistle of Calling
DESCRIPTION: Teleport animal companion back to yourself 1/day
NOTES: If you're a hunter and can see through your companon's eyes, makes using it as a scout much safer. Alternatively, lets anyone get their companion places you couldn't otherwise bring it

NAME: Lithomancy Stones
DESCRIPTION: 1/day divination with no material component, as long as you can hit some pretty brutalPlanes  DCs
NOTES: This is actually cheaper than a pearl of power to cast divination, even not including ignoring the material component. Depends a lot on how cryptic your DM tends to be with divination

NAME: Eye of the Mantis
DESCRIPTION: Lil mantis boy who scouts for you once/day
NOTES: Really cheap way to get a scout. Shame it can die, but best budget information item by far.

NAME: Insistent Doorknocker
DESCRIPTION: 1/day just plonk a door on a random wall
NOTES: Gets you through a wall. Getting the doorknocker back if you want to go through the door and stay on the other side is sort of awkward

NAME: Hat of Disguise
DESCRIPTION: Creates constant flawless disguise. Disguise is just an illusion, so if you adopt a form with a different body shape to your own physical interactions give things away.

NAME: Hat of Disguise, Greater
DESCRIPTION: As hat of disguise, but the disguise is physical and gives bonuses.
NOTES: Can give combinations of swim speed + water breathing, dark / low light vision, scent, and +2 size bonus to Str or Dex.

NAME: Gloves of Elvenkind
DESCRIPTION: +5 on Spellcraft checks, as well as concentration to cast defensively

NAME: Ring of Seven Lovely Colours
DESCRIPTION: Turn into a songbird 7/day, also acts as a ring of protection +1
NOTES: Really, really cheap way to get flight and an innocuous scouting form. 7/day is basicallly at-will.

NAME: Slippers of Scampering
DESCRIPTION: Crawl on walls for 10 rounds/day

NAME: Slippers of Spider Climbing
DESCRIPTION: Crawl on walls for 10 minutes/day

NAME: Eyes of the Eagle
DESCRIPTION: +5 competence to Perception checks

NAME: Trap-stealer's Rod
DESCRIPTION: Grants a number of bonuses related to trapfinding, and lets you move a trap around; if you can craft traps yourself, this makes them viable combat options
NOTES: Building around a 13.5k item is probably a bad idea, so unless you're starting at high levels the trap deployer build is probably not a thing. Still, makes you good at traps.

NAME: Immovable Rod
DESCRIPTION: Rod that hangs in place when a button is pressed.
NOTES: Classic utility. With two, ladder into space. Block a door, stop a fall, convenient anchor point for a pulley.

NAME: Ring of Sustenance
DESCRIPTION: Only sleep for 2 hours and no eating or drinking
NOTES: No food/water is whatever, but needing less sleep lets you keep watch all night and/or craft while everyone sleeps.

NAME: Communique Rings
DESCRIPTION: Lets two people communicate from a mile away - price is for a pair of rings
NOTES: Solo scouting is both dangerous and kinda unfun, as everyone but the scout is sitting around doing nothing. Still, if your party likes it, these are good for that.

NAME: Glamered armour
DESCRIPTION: Allows you to disguise your armour, including disguising it as not-armour
NOTES: Perform false flag operations, wear full plate to the baron's gala, change up your aesthetic every day for no reason.

NAME: Hosteling armour
DESCRIPTION: Allows you to store your companion in your armour and bring it back out as a standard action
NOTES: Always have your companion with you, even in a party, even in a dungeon

NAME: Delving armour
DESCRIPTION: Gives you a burrow speed, though only through earth (not stone); you cannot breathe while burrowing.
NOTES: Not stone means no going through walls, but great for hit-and-run tactics.

NAME: Saltspray Ring
DESCRIPTION: Lets you cloak yourself in a cloud of mist that follows you
NOTES: BUSTED. Highly effective at protecting you from ranged attacks, but prevents you from seeing anything not immediately in front of you. If you have mistsight, this is sort of insane

NAME: Deadeye's Spotter Ring
DESCRIPTION: Minor bonuses on Perception and Survival, also lets you send an animal messenger 1/day.
NOTES: Perception is a useful skill, I could see campaigns where you use animal messenger a lot.

NAME: Ring of Feather Falling
DESCRIPTION: Completely protects from falls
NOTES: Completely protects from falls

NAME: Scholar's Ring
DESCRIPTION: Grants understanding of all languages, +5 on knowledge (history), and Legend Lore (a 6th-level divination) every five days
NOTES: Nice package of useful abilities. Knowledge (history) is to my mind kinda underrated with how much fantasy likes Ancient Prophecies and the like. Plus, Legend Lore is good.

NAME: Pact Patchment
DESCRIPTION: Allows you to make a contract magically binding, imposing quite severe penalties on those who break it.
NOTES: Quite pricey for general use, but has more potential to drive the plot than most items

NAME: Broom of Flying
DESCRIPTION: Flying broom
NOTES: The cheapest general-use way to get (basically) permanent flight. Fighting while on one of these seems sort of jank, but it seems to be possible?

NAME: Spellguard Bracers
DESCRIPTION: +2 on concentration to cast defensively, and 3/day roll twice when doing that
NOTES: Good for casters who expect to be in melee a lot, whether that's because they're choosing to be or because they're pessimistic

NAME: Dust of Dryness
DESCRIPTION: Stores or instantly releases 100 gallons of water
NOTES: That's a lot of water to just kinda drop all at once, 16 cubic feet. Could plausilby be quite destructive.

NAME: Traveler's Any-tool
DESCRIPTION: Can be used as any mundane tool, and grants a +2 competence bonus when using it
NOTES: Cheap, good.

NAME: Rope of Climbing
DESCRIPTION: Rope that can be commanded to move and attach itself to things.

NAME: Rope of Knots
DESCRIPTION: Rope that can be commanded to move, attach itself to things, and make structures like bridges and nets

NAME: Necklace of Adaptation
DESCRIPTION: Gives you an air bubble that ensures you can always breathe and protects you from gas effects.
NOTES: Quite niche as an immunity, but intentionally used as friendly fire protection it makes cloud spells quite attractive

NAME: Sandals of the Lightest Step
DESCRIPTION: Walk on air for 1 round 5/day
NOTES: Not that great for vertical mobility unless you're very fast, but good for ignoring difficult terrain and ground-based effects

NAME: Headband of Intuition
DESCRIPTION: Tells you if a given action will have a good or bad outcome in the next half hour 3/day.
NOTES: Usually best used before doing something that may be incredibly stupid. If you're creative, can detect a bunch of stuff - "open a box" tells you if the box is trapped, "fight someone" tells you if you're likely to win, etc. etc.

NAME: Robe of Infinite Twine
DESCRIPTION: Infinite rope! As an immediate action, for some reason.
NOTES: Rope is good infinite rope is infinite good

NAME: Field Scrivener's Desk
DESCRIPTION: 1/day creates a writing desk. Which is surrounded by a 20ft radius magical hemisphere that prevents people from seeing in, though you can see out, and protects you from the elements.
NOTES: Protects you from most targeted spells. Nice lil sniper perch.

NAME: Miser's Mask
DESCRIPTION: Gives you scent, but for coins and gems. Also gives +5 competence to Appraise.
NOTES: Comparable to detect secret doors always-on.

NAME: Stagger-proof Boots
DESCRIPTION: More or less stops trip (and being knocked prone in general) from being scary, and lets you move 1/day as an immediate action.
NOTES: Offers no protection against being staggered. But, absolutely insane. Off-turn movement is something pathfinder doesn't really handle. When someone moves up to you, just move away and turn ghost them

NAME: Crown of Swords
DESCRIPTION: If someone attacks you, summon a sword to attack them back as an immediate action.
NOTES: Will fail to overcome all but the most pathetic SR, but scales with your BAB (including getting iteratives) so relevant for a surprisingly long amount of time. Better if you have decent Wisdom.

NAME: Circlet of Persuasion
DESCRIPTION: +3 bonus on Charisma-based checks
NOTES: Aside from boosting social skills, it makes certain spells and class features work better

NAME: Headband of the Wolf
DESCRIPTION: Gives you scent, but with the tiniest range there ever was.
NOTES: Gives you just enough forewarning to deny invisible (melee) enemies a surprise round, and enables scent-based tracking, so for the price still pretty good

NAME: Bottled Cloud
DESCRIPTION: Throw bottle to make solid fog
NOTES: Quite expensive for a consumable, but solid fog is a very strong control effect that offers no save so works well from an item, especially because being thrown lets you mix it in with iterative attacks

NAME: Looter's Satchel
DESCRIPTION: Bag of holding but you can schlorp up everything a corpse has on it into the bag with a word.
NOTES: The speed at which you steal from the recently deceased rarely matters, but it's funny there's an item for it

NAME: Quill of Passage
DESCRIPTION: Lets you draw doors on walls you can then walk through.
NOTES: Compared to the Insistent Doorknocker, works more times/day and has no issues with recovering the item, but has finite duration and needs a thinner wall

NAME: Kyton Ring
DESCRIPTION: Makes chain and serves as a grappling hook.
NOTES: Limited amount/day while the Robe of Rope is infinite, but has the grappling hook and chain is better for tying people up

NAME: Carpet of Flying
DESCRIPTION: Permanent flight
NOTES: Slightly more expensive than the broom of flying, but less ambiguity about whether you need to use hands. You can more plausibly be knocked off, however

NAME: Robe of Blending
DESCRIPTION: 1 hour/day of alter self
NOTES: Can give low light / darkvision, swim speed and water breathing, scent, and +2 size bonus to Str or Dexy

NAME: Ring of Invisibility
DESCRIPTION: At-will invisibility
NOTES: Magic ring frodo ring

NAME: Mnemonic Vestment
DESCRIPTION: Lets a spontaneous caster cast a spell they don't know once/day, as long as they have a scroll of it.
NOTES: Quite expensive as a means of expanding spells known, but opens up off-day spells you still want to cast more than once like Animate Dead

NAME: Nightmare Boots
DESCRIPTION: Concealment while charging. 3/day gain concealment as a swift action until end of next turn. When you hit someone in melee, explode with flames 1/day
NOTES: The concealment while charging gets really good once monsters grow larger and gain reach. If you lack a use for your swift action getting some unconditional concealment is quite nice. The flame burst is largely useless, however

NAME: Bag of Holding (Type 1)
DESCRIPTION: Bag that extradimensionally contains 30 cubic feet / 250 pounds
NOTES: Store things

NAME: Horse-caller's Flute
DESCRIPTION: Make a perform(wind) check to summon a horse. Lasts longer the higher your result.
NOTES: Much more expensive than just buying horses, but still has uses. In enclosed spaces, an instant horse is basically a wall. Also, if you can quick mount then you can summon and get on the horse in one turn, and have it immediately start running, which both looks cool and wins any land chase.

NAME: Pentacle Talisman (Lesser)
DESCRIPTION: Gives you a reroll against mind control and possession. If you succeed on the reroll, gain immunity for 5 rounds. One-use.
NOTES: Mind control is really scary. Can be worn with up to 2 other talismans.

NAME: Pentacle Talisman (Greater)
DESCRIPTION: Gives you a reroll against mind control and possession. If you succeed on the reroll, gain immunity for 5 rounds. One/day
NOTES: Mind control is really scary. Can be worn with up to 2 other talismans.

NAME: Life's Breath Talisman (Lesser)
DESCRIPTION: Immediately resurrects you if you die. One-use
NOTES: Honestly less amazing than it sounds because the resurrection is immediate. Things'll just keep attacking you. Doesn't mention any obvious display, maybe you can play dead?

NAME: Life's Breath Talisman (Greater)
DESCRIPTION: Immediately resurrects you if you die. One/day
NOTES: Honestly less amazing than it sounds because the resurrection is immediate. Things'll just keep attacking you. Doesn't mention any obvious display, maybe you can play dead?

NAME: Freedom Talisman (Lesser)
DESCRIPTION: Gives you freedom of movement if grappled/entangled/paralyzed. One-use
NOTES: Paralyzed especially just takes you out of the fight. This just lets you ignore it, doesn't even require you to succeed on a reroll

NAME: Freedom Talisman (Greater)
DESCRIPTION: Gives you freedom of movement if grappled/entangled/paralyzed. One/day
NOTES: Paralyzed especially just takes you out of the fight. This just lets you ignore it, doesn't even require you to succeed on a reroll

NAME: Warrior's Courage Talisman (Lesser)
DESCRIPTION: When you would suffer severe fear, just become shaken. One-use
NOTES: Frightened and cowering take you out of the fight. Shaken doesn't. Automatically downgrading fear to shaken is good.

NAME: Warrior's Courage Talisman (Greater)
DESCRIPTION: When you would suffer severe fear, just become shaken. Once/day
NOTES: Frightened and cowering take you out of the fight. Shaken doesn't. Automatically downgrading fear to shaken is good.

NAME: Beneficial Winds Talisman (Lesser)
DESCRIPTION: When you would fall, take no damage. One use
NOTES: How often do you really fall. Do you really need a ring of feather falling? This is cheaper. A lot cheaper.

NAME: Beneficial Winds Talisman (Greater)
DESCRIPTION: When you would fall, take no damage. Once/day
NOTES: How often do you really fall. Do you really need a ring of feather falling? This is cheaper. A lot cheaper.

NAME: Lucky Horseshoe
DESCRIPTION: +1 luck bonus on all saves. Once/day, increase this to +4 (no action)
NOTES: Gives +2 to all saves very cheaply with the Fate's Favoured trait

NAME: Wand of Cure Light Wounds
DESCRIPTION: Need spell on class list or Use Magic Device check, DC20. Heals 1d8+1 hp
NOTES: Standard healing item if you can't use infernal healing wands

NAME: Scabbard of Vigor
DESCRIPTION: 1/day, give weapon enhancement bonus when you draw it
NOTES: The sweet spot is probably +3 enhancement bonus for 3 rounds. At low levels, that's +2 to hit and damage. Respectable for a free action.

NAME: Goggles of Minute Seeing
DESCRIPTION: +5 competence bonus on Disable Device checks
NOTES: Disable Device DCs get really high in Paizo APs. If you want to deal with traps the old-fashioned way, this helps a lot

NAME: First Aid Gloves
DESCRIPTION: Gloves have 10 sapphires; spend sapphires to cast healing spells
NOTES: These are pretty inefficient. However, they provide a way for a non-caster to Breath of Life someone. Don't need to be drawn, either, which is important

NAME: Boots of Speed
DESCRIPTION: Free action haste, 10 rounds/day (which you may divide up)
NOTES: Competitive with casting haste when it comes to giving the party access to an extra attack at higher levels. Buying a Lesser Quicken Rod costs about as much as three sets of these boots, and also costs the party wizard some level 3 slots and a swift action.

NAME: Wand of Mudball
DESCRIPTION: Need spell on class list or Use Magic Device check, DC20. Blind a target on a ranged touched attack, with a save at the start of their turns to remove. You may need to be a goblin to buy this.
NOTES: This seems kind of mediocre, until you realise the COOL SECRET TECHNIQUE: ready an action to mudball someone as soon as they do anything. They don't get the save until their next turn, so one turn of guaranteed blindness. Good way to turn ghost an enemy.

NAME: Gloves of Arcane Striking
DESCRIPTION: Improve your Aid Another based on the bonus granted by your Arcane Strike feat
NOTES: Very weird item, but can dramatically increase the AC you grant allies with Aid Another

NAME: Wand of Infernal Healing
DESCRIPTION: Need spell on class list or Use Magic Device check, DC20. Heals 10hp over 10 rounds
NOTES: Evil, but most cost-efficient healing in the game

NAME: Apron of the Careful Chemist
DESCRIPTION: +2 enhancement to Dex, +2 competence to Craft(Alchemy), when you use an item that gives an alchemical bonus to a save it gives an extra +1
NOTES: Mainly useful for the dex boost in a weird slot

NAME: Ring of Spell Knowledge (Type 1)
DESCRIPTION: Must be spontaneous arcane caster. With DC20 spellcraft check, teach the ring a 1st level spell. Treat it as a spell known. Can do off-list spells at +1 spell level increase cost.
NOTES: Many classes have spells at unusually low spell levels. This lets you poach them.

NAME: Ring of Spell Knowledge (Type 2)
DESCRIPTION: Must be spontaneous arcane caster. With DC20 spellcraft check, teach the ring a 2nd level spell. Treat it as a spell known. Can do off-list spells at +1 spell level increase cost.
NOTES: Many classes have spells at unusually low spell levels. This lets you poach them.

NAME: Ring of Spell Knowledge (Type 3)
DESCRIPTION: Must be spontaneous arcane caster. With DC20 spellcraft check, teach the ring a 3rd level spell. Treat it as a spell known. Can do off-list spells at +1 spell level increase cost.
NOTES: Many classes have spells at unusually low spell levels. This lets you poach them.

NAME: Ring of Spell Knowledge (Type 4)
DESCRIPTION: Must be spontaneous arcane caster. With DC20 spellcraft check, teach the ring a 4th level spell. Treat it as a spell known. Can do off-list spells at +1 spell level increase cost.
NOTES: Many classes have spells at unusually low spell levels. This lets you poach them.

NAME: Deep Red Sphere Ioun Stone
DESCRIPTION: +2 enhancement to Dex
NOTES: Useful to strength-based AoO builds, who want a Str belt and more Dex for AoOs

NAME: Scarlet and Blue Sphere Ioun Stone
DESCRIPTION: +2 enhancement to Int, gives you max ranks in a single skill (set at time of stone's creation)
NOTES: Gives you an extra skill without taking up a slot. Useful for skills like Use Magic Device and Fly that aren't useful until higher levels

NAME: Pink Rhomboid Ioun Stone
DESCRIPTION: +2 enhancement to Con

NAME: Ioun Torch
DESCRIPTION: Stone that orbits your head, sheds light as a torch

NAME: Rod of the Thriceborn, Lesser
DESCRIPTION: Targets of a spell must roll 3 times, take middle result
NOTES: If you're confident in your saving throw DCs, reducing variance with this item probably makes your spells land more often. Much, much cheaper than a rod of Persistent Spell.

NAME: Rod of Ice
DESCRIPTION: Weapon that makes touch attacks and deals cold damage. 1/day ice slick that acts as grease in a large cone
NOTES: If this can be used to make iteratives, it's amazing for people with sneak attack. Even if not... maybe still worth it, just for turns you can't full attack?

NAME: Stubborn Nail
DESCRIPTION: Nail you can stick through anything without damaging it.
NOTES: Stick things together, weld them shut, use as an anchor point for something, etc. etc. etc.

NAME: Stunstone
DESCRIPTION: To everything in 10ft burst when thrown: minor sonic damage, save vs stun, and faerie fire
NOTES: Much more expensive than scroll of faerie fire, but has a bigger burst (so your guess needs to be less good), arguably bypasses SR, and can be thrown by familiars etc.

NAME: Iron Bands of Binding
DESCRIPTION: Ranged touch attack to immobilise creature, can be escaped with Escape Artist / CMB / Strength check. 1/day
NOTES: At the very least trades turns with the target. Against some enemies (casters without Somatic-free teleportation) just wins the fight.

NAME: Ring of Eloquence
DESCRIPTION: Lets you speak a language, even if the form you're in isn't capable of speech. +2 on some social checks. Reduced spell failure chance from deafness.
NOTES: Mostly good for wild shapers, so they can actually talk to other PCs while being a bear all day

NAME: Ring of Counterspells
DESCRIPTION: Cast a spell of up to 6th level into the ring. If that spell is cast targeting you, expend the spell in the ring and negate that spell.
NOTES: The usual suggestion for what should go in here is Dispel Magic - having all your buffs dispelled early in the day can really ruin the rest of it

NAME: Swarmbane Clasp
DESCRIPTION: Autopass saves against swarm distraction, and damage swarms with weapon attacks normally

NAME: Dire Collar
DESCRIPTION: Person who placed collar round animal can cause it to enlarge

NAME: Pearl of Power, 1st level
DESCRIPTION: Regain an expended 1st-level prepared spell
NOTES: Not that great on full casters, but nice on partial casters who have reduced-level spells. Standout uses: fuelling Divine Interference, lesser restoration on paladins, deivon's parry or metamagic-reduced shocking grasp on magi

NAME: Pearl of Power, 2nd level
DESCRIPTION: Regain an expended 2nd-level prepared spell
NOTES: Not that great on full casters, but nice on partial casters who have reduced-level spells

NAME: Pearl of Power, 3rd level
DESCRIPTION: Regain an expended 3rd-level prepared spell
NOTES: Not that great on full casters, but nice on partial casters who have reduced-level spells. Standout uses: instant enemy on rangers

NAME: Deathwatch Eyes
DESCRIPTION: Constant deathwatch
NOTES: Lets you detect undead, creatures feigning death, creatures disguised as inanimate objects
